message: Thank you to Collin County Sheriff Jim Skinner and our north Texas law enforcement officials for a great meeting last week. I appreciated learning more about your efforts to protect our community from security threats and help folks travel safely. God bless you and I salute you!

ICYMI, I just spoke on the House Floor in support of my resolution to protect the 2nd Amendment rights of certain Social Security disability beneficiaries - a resolution widely supported by the disability community (including the National Council on Disability and the American Civil Liberties Union) as well as the National Rifle Assion. I look forward to the House voting on this important measure later today.

Happy Birthday to our 40th President of the United States, Ronald Reagan!  He faithfully served our country, and he continues to inspire generations with his hope and humor.  Today I invite you to join me in honoring this great American!

ICYMI, earlier this morning I chaired the first of two Committee on Ways and Means Social Security hearings on representative payees (people Social Security authorizes to receive benefit payments on behalf of a beneficiary). About 5.5 million people get help from a representative payee to manage their benefits. The Institute of Medicine, Social Security Inspector General, and Social Security itself have all raised serious questions about the representative payee program, and today we took a fresh look at this issue. To learn more and watch the full hearing, CLICK HERE: https://waysandmeans.house.gov/event/joint-hearing-social-securitys-representative-payee-program/

ICYMI, this week I reintroduced a commonsense bill to cut waste at the EPA.  This is a bill I introduced last Congress, and it’s estimated that it would save taxpayers more than $7.5 BILLION.  As a fiscal conservative, I believe it’s important to be good stewards of YOUR tax dollars.  You can learn more about my bill HERE: http://samjohnson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398556

Great article on what my EPA bill ACTUALLY does and WHY it's needed: "This bill would save Americans billions of dollars. More importantly, it would restore freedom and responsibility to steward the environment back to states and individuals.  It seems that as the environment has gotten cleaner, the EPA has gotten more aggressive and expansive in its mission. For example, air pollution has decreased dramatically since the EPA started keeping tabs in 1980. Ground-level ozone (smog) levels have fallen by 32 percent, nitrogen dioxide by 60 percent, carbon monoxide by 84 percent, and lead by 99 percent since 1980..." READ https://www.google.com/amp/dailysignal.com/2017/02/10/one-lawmakers-plan-to-reform-the-epa/amp/?client=safari

Today marks the 44th Anniversary of "Operation Homecoming." It was on this day that my fellow POWs at the Hanoi Hilton and I were finally released and began the journey back to our families. It is a day I remember all of the work our POW wives and a few dedicated Americans did to bring us home. During the Vietnam War, many Americans believed the North Vietnamese propaganda that we POWs were being treated well in accordance with the Geneva Convention. We were not, and getting the truth out was an uphill battle that our wives fought. Today I remember the service and sacrifice of these brave women and the patriots who fought alongside them. And I pray for our military families who are currently apart - that the Lord brings you safely back together. God bless you and God bless America. I salute you.

Need help with a federal agency? My staff and I are happy to help and will open a case on your behalf with the federal agency. Although my staff cannot override a decision or compel a particular outcome regarding your concern, they will do their best to assist you.  In fact, on Wednesday we will be hosting our monthly Mobile Office Hours in Lucas, Plano, Wylie, and McKinney.  You can get in-person assistance.    What issues can we help you with? LEARN MORE here: http://samjohnson.house.gov/constituentservices/mobile-office-hours/default.aspx

While I couldn’t deliver this year’s Valentines for Veterans in person due to votes in Washington,  my staff enjoyed giving out the heartfelt valentines our 3rd District students made.  We also ran into some friendly faces during Salute to Veterans week – a few of the Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders were at the VA to help thank our servicemen and women!  Thank you to all the students as well as the Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders for supporting our veterans.  And of course, my heartfelt thanks goes out to all our veterans and troops who have served in defense of freedom.  God bless you and God bless America.  I salute you!

As folks may know, this week marks the 44th Anniversary of “Operation Homecoming” when I returned home from North Vietnam.  In memory of my fellow POWs and those Missing in Action (MIAs) who never made it home, today fellow Hanoi Hilton POW Senator John McCain and I introduced identical resolutions in the House and Senate calling for intensified efforts to investigate, recover, and identify all missing and unaccounted-for personnel of the United States. Our American Armed Forces swear to leave no man behind, which is why I have vowed I will never stop fighting for our Defenders of Freedom – just like our POW wives did for us.  My commitment to this country and those who fight for it will never end.

Today I introduced legislation to help address Obamacare's negative impacts on small businesses and American families.  This bill is called the Small Business Health Fairness Act (H.R. 1101), and it would allow for the creation of Association health plans for small businesses so they are able to have strength in numbers just like larger employers do.  To learn more about my bill, watch the video and CLICK HERE: http://samjohnson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398561

ICYMI, yesterday I introduced a bill to help provide Americans access to quality, affordable health care - something I’m sure folks can agree everyone deserves.  Likewise, I’m sure we also agree that competition in the marketplace is a good thing.  Unfortunately, Obamacare has been picking winners and losers when it comes to health care – and American families are paying the price due to this lack of competition.  You see, buried inside this bad law is a provision that permanently bans further construction of physician-owned hospitals (POH) and essentially prevents existing ones from expanding.  This is wrong.  Physician-owned hospitals are small in number, so there is plenty of room in the health care market.  It makes no sense to prohibit good hospitals from serving their communities. My bill is about doing the right thing.  Americans want, need, and deserve quality, affordable health care options. LEARN MORE HERE: http://samjohnson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398564

It's been great to meet with folks this week to discuss issues important to our 3rd District of Texas. Whether it's visiting with constituents or local business owners, I always appreciate hearing your thoughts and concerns. A big thank you to Brian Deaver and Dr. Terry James for stopping by my office to discuss legislation that's key to helping Plano's Kersh Health be successful. I appreciate your hard work and dedication to our healthcare system. Likewise, I thank New York Life's efforts on behalf of 13,000 policy holders in our district.    And as always, if you would like to meet with me in either Plano or Washington, D.C. - or if you need assistance with a federal agency , CLICK HERE: http://samjohnson.house.gov/contact-me/

After eight long years of Obama’s liberal, big government agenda, it was refreshing to hear President Trump's patriotic words and love of country tonight as he discussed solutions that will actually get our country back on track and help American families.  Our country is facing many challenges when it comes to national security, and as a 29-year Air Force veteran I appreciate our new Commander-In-Chief making strides to protect our homeland.  With a much-needed boost to defense, our troops will be better able to address the serious threats left unaddressed by former President Obama. Similarly, tackling illegal immigration and securing our borders will further strengthen national security – not to mention the fact that these efforts do right by hardworking American taxpayers.   President Trump is also right to work with House Republicans as we repeal Obamacare and replace it with commonsense health care reforms.  Not only will folks have more freedom when it comes to health care choices, but getting rid of Obamacare – which has been a major burden on small businesses – will help boost our economy.   Finally, as a fiscal conservative I wholeheartedly agree that it’s high time we reform our tax code – including the IRS!   We’ve got a lot of good work ahead of us, and I look forward to making progress on the key challenges confronting our great nation in the weeks and months ahead.

WATCH LIVE: The Education and Workforce Committee is holding a hearing on my legislation, the Small Business Health Fairness Act (HR 1101). This bill is part of a step-by-step process to replace the failed Obamacare law with patient-centered solutions. It would empower small businesses to join together through association health plans (AHPs) to provide their employees greater access to affordable health care. Learn more here: http://samjohnson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398561  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d3LRrAKUBzs&feature=youtu.be

Today we celebrate Texas Independence Day and everything that makes the Lone Star State great!  As Texans, we have so much to be thankful for...the beauty of God's Country, the friendly faces of our family and friends, our rich resources in our own backyard, a state government that fosters an environment for healthy job creation and economic growth...the list goes on.  And the Third District in particular is particularly blessed!  In fact, many cities in our area are frequently ranked in the top ten places to live nationwide. May God continue to bless Texas - and our Great Nation.

Happy Birthday to our United States Navy Reserve!  Thank you for your service to our Great Nation and for honorably defending Freedom! Also, it is my pleasure to let you know that yesterday I reintroduced a bill I think you - and ALL our Reserve and Guard Forces - will be happy to hear about.  This is the Servicemember Retirement Improvement Act, and it would stop the IRS from limiting the ability of Guard and Reserve service members to save for their retirement.  You and your families shouldn't be penalized when it comes to saving for retirement just because you happen to serve our country.  This is just one small but tangible way we can show our thanks for your service and sacrifice.  Again, Happy Birthday to our U.S. Navy Reserve! And if you'd like to learn more about my bill, CLICK HERE: http://samjohnson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398566

The House Republican plan to repeal and replace Obamacare, which continues to hurt American families with higher costs and fewer health care option, is here. I encourage you to #readthebill !   https://housegop.leadpages.co/healthcare/

TUNE IN LIVE: the Committee on Ways and Means is marking up the American Healthcare Act to repeal and replace Obamacare.  ALSO, if you haven't yet, I encourage you to read the bill. You can find it at readthebill.gop! https://waysandmeans.house.gov/live/

ALSO, the House Committee on Energy and Commerce is marking up their portion of the American Healthcare Act to repeal and replace Obamacare.  To watch their mark-up LIVE, tune in here: https://energycommerce.house.gov/hearings-and-votes/markups/markup-committee-print-and-h-res-154

Why is it necessary to repeal and replace Obamacare? There are many reasons...and here is just one.  Learn about Jilian in the link below.  Many folks are in similar situations.   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qmw4RfpK-9Y  Learn more about why Obamacare isn't working here: http://samjohnson.house.gov/issues/issue/?IssueID=797  And to read the American Health Care Act, visit readthebill.gop.

ICYMI, Early this morning, the Ways and Means Committee concluded its Markup on five budget reconciliation recommendations that make up part of the American Healthcare Reform Act – the Republican plan to repeal and replace Obamacare.  Once joined with the reconciliation recommendations from the Energy and Commerce Committee, these bills will make up the American Healthcare Reform Act.  (To read the full bill, visit readthebill.gop.)   Notably, the bill repeals the individual and employer mandate; stops the $1 trillion in tax increases that have hurt American families from all walks of life; continues to protect folks with pre-existing conditions; and allows children 26 and under to stay on their parents’ health care plan.    As a conservative who opposed Obamacare at every turn, I’m pleased that – with a Republican in the White House – we are finally able to move forward with a real plan to repeal and replace Obama’s disastrous law.  While I recognize that the Republican bill is not perfect, it’s a good and necessary step in the right direction – and my work on this issue won’t be done.  There are still many conservative solutions that I would like to see put into effect that budget rules prohibit us from including in reconciliation – solutions like the ability to purchase health care plans across state lines as well as the bill I introduced (H.R. 1101) to allow small businesses to join together through association health plans (AHPs).  In fact, H.R. 1101 passed the Education and Workforce Committee yesterday!  THREE-STEP PLAN TO REPEAL AND REPLACE OBAMACARE: 1)      Pass the reconciliation bill – the American Healthcare Reform Act. 2)      Health and Human Services Secretary Tom Price will have regulatory flexibility to deregulate the marketplace to help lower costs and stabilize the market.  3)      Congress will follow up on the reconciliation with further solutions (such as purchasing health care across state lines).

ICYMI: Today I reintroduced bipartisan legislation to help protect folks from identity theft. This bill, the Social Security MAIL Act, would prohibit the Social Security Administration from including Social Security numbers (SSNs) in mail it sends unless the SSN inclusion is absolutely necessary.  LEARN MORE HERE:  https://waysandmeans.house.gov/ways-means-members-introduce-bipartisan-legislation-protect-americans-identity-theft/

SAVE THE DATE: On April 8th, I invite you to attend a training workshop on the Library of Congress’ Veterans History Project (VHP).  What is VHP? Congress created the program in 2000 as part of the American Folklife Center at the Library of Congress.  The VHP’s mission is to “collect, preserve, and make accessible the personal accounts of American war veterans so that future generations may hear directly from veterans and better understand the realities of war.”  Since its establishment, thousands of veterans have submitted their stories from World War I, World War II, the Korean War, the Vietnam War, the Persian Gulf War, and Operations Iraq and Enduring Freedom.   HOWEVER, currently, only 15,106 of the 1,670,186 veterans in Texas have recorded their personal history.     For more email about the event, please click on the link HERE:  http://samjohnson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398575  Also, please RSVP to events.tx03@mail.house.gov or by calling (469) 304-0382 so that my staff can may make proper accommodations and ensure sufficient training materials.

ICYMI: at the end of last month, President Trump signed into law H.J.Res 40, my legislation that protects social security beneficiaries who need help managing their benefits from having their Constitutional rights violated by an Obama Administration’s regulation.  This bill is supported by a wide range of bipartisan groups including the NRA and the ACLU.  Today, I received the pen used to sign the bill into law.  To read the statements of support on this law, CLICK HERE: https://waysandmeans.house.gov/theyre-saying-house-action-protect-rights-social-security-beneficiaries/

It was great visiting with Jeff Rinard and David Slayton before this morning's joint Social Security and Oversight Subcommittee hearing on Social Security's Representative Payee Program.  I thank them both for their work at the Texas Office of Court Administration, and I also thank Dr. Slayton (far right) for providing witness testimony at the hearing.    To watch the hearing LIVE, CLICK HERE: https://waysandmeans.house.gov/live/  To learn more, CLICK HERE: https://waysandmeans.house.gov/buchanan-johnson-announce-second-joint-hearing-social-securitys-representative-payee-program/

Today the House is considering my bill, the Small Business Health Fairness Act (H.R. 1101).  This bill would allow small businesses to band together through association health plans, or AHPs, to provide good health care policies for workers and their families at a lower cost.  It's a central part of replacing Obamacare with commonsense, patient-centered solutions.  To learn more, check out my op-ed in the Wall Street Journal!

ICYMI, earlier today I took to the House Floor urging my colleagues to support the Small Business Health Fairness Act - legislation that empowers small businesses to band together through association health plans (AHPs) and negotiate for lower health insurance costs on behalf of their employees. This is an effort I've been working on for several years, and I'm pleased the House just passed it with bipartisan support!  This legislation is an important part of replacing Obamacare with commonsense solutions.

The 35th Congressional Art Competition for high school students is officially underway!  If you or someone you know would like to participate, please click on the link below for full details on important deadlines, rules issued by the Congressional Institute (who oversees the competition), and information on how to submit artwork!  If you have follow-up questions, please call my Plano office at 469-304-0382. http://samjohnson.house.gov/constituentservices/artcontest.htm

In honor of Vietnam Veterans Day, I thank my fellow service members who served in Vietnam.  I  also have some special announcements I believe you will be interested in hearing.    First, to all the brave veterans who served in the Vietnam War, I thank you for your service and your sacrifice in the name of freedom.  As a POW for nearly seven years, my POW buddies and I were given a very warm welcoming home upon our return in 1973.  But so many of you were treated unfairly upon your return home from Vietnam and not given the warm welcome you also deserved.  This is wrong.  ALL our faithful servicemen and women deserve our deepest gratitude and utmost respect.  So today, I want to let you know your service and sacrifice is appreciated – and you are welcomed home.    I also want to let you know about 1) an upcoming event in our district on behalf of veterans as well as 2) a resolution I introduced this Congress calling for intensified efforts to account for all U.S. forces who still remain Missing in Action (MIA).   1) On April 8th, in order to help local veterans and their families preserve stories of heroism, patriotism, and sacrifice, my staff will be hosting a training workshop on the Library of Congress’ Veterans History Project (VHP).  Preserving veterans’ stories are so important, and I encourage folks to attend. For information on this event and to RSVP so sufficient training materials are available, CLICK HERE: http://samjohnson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398575   2) Additionally, Senator John McCain and I introduced identical resolutions in the House and Senate calling for intensified efforts to investigate, recover, and identify all missing and unaccounted-for personnel of the United States.  Learn more here: http://samjohnson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398559

Congratulations to our combined Frisco hockey team for a stellar performance at the HS hockey national championship - and for bringing home the title!  What a victory to become the first Texas school to do so!  #friscoyouknow

The House wrapped up six weeks of session today! To get a recap of my efforts over the last few weeks - including info about one of my bills signed into law and another passed by the House - check out my e-newsletter in the link below! http://samjohnson.house.gov/news/email/show.aspx?ID=YAPJDPZZH56VX5NBUABFPDOMGQ

DEADLINE MONDAY! If you are a high school student residing in the 3rd District who would like to participate in the 35th annual Congressional Art Competition, don't forget to have your parent or teacher RSVP by Monday!  Full details can be found here: http://samjohnson.house.gov/constituentservices/artcontest.htm

As families celebrate Easter and the hope and renewal Jesus represents, I'm reminded of how blessed we are to live in this Great Nation where we have the freedom of religion. I went without this freedom for nearly seven years in the Hanoi Hilton where my POW buddies and I were punished for worshipping God. To be home and with family on this day always means so much to me, and I wish you and your family and Happy Easter Sunday.  Let us carry this day's message with us always. God bless you and God bless America. I salute you.

REMINDER to all teachers and their students who are participating in this year's Congressional Art Competition - all finished artwork must be turned into my office by THIS Friday at 5pm! If you have any questions, please call my Plano office at 469-304-0382!

Folks know that illegal immigration can put large financial burdens on taxpayers – including public education, welfare, and benefits.  One such benefit is the Refundable Child Tax Credit.  You see, right now the IRS doesn’t require Social Security numbers for this credit.  The Inspector General said that as a result, illegal immigrants can get thousands of dollars from the IRS.  It’s no surprise that it also encourages more illegals to come here.  To stop this credit abuse,TODAY I INTRODUCED H.R. 2149, which requires individuals to provide their Social Security numbers if they want to claim this tax credit.  This is commonsense bill passed by the House before, and it’s something hardworking, taxpaying Americans want, need, and deserve.

VOTE NOW THROUGH FRIDAY!  The Congressional Art Competition for high school students continues with the 2017 People’s Choice Award.   From now through May 5th at 5pm CST, I invite Collin County constituents to view all 95 high school students’ entries on my website and vote for their favorite! https://samjohnson.house.gov/forms/form/?ID=3106

On Silver Star Service Banner Day, I want to thank all of the brave men and women who have served in our nation’s Armed Forces.  As a veteran of two wars, and the recipient of two Silver Stars myself, I’d especially like to recognize America’s veterans who were wounded in combat.  Your service and sacrifice to our Great Nation is appreciated today and always.  I also want to let you know that on Friday I introduced a bill called the HEARTS Act that is focused on ensuring that wounded veterans have access to the care and services they have earned.   Specifically, this bill would address an unintended consequence that affects veterans who are severely injured and qualify for disability due to their military service.   The HEARTS Act would repeal the requirement that these wounded warriors maintain – and pay for – Medicare coverage upon returning to work in order to keep their access to TRICARE.  To learn more about this bill, please click on the link below.    Again, I thank our servicemen and women as well as their families for all they have done in defense of Freedom.  God bless you, and God bless America.  I salute you.     CLICK HERE to learn more about the HEARTS Act: http://samjohnson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398704    CLICK HERE to learn more about my efforts on behalf of veterans: http://samjohnson.house.gov/issues/issue/?IssueID=805    If you are a veteran and need assistance with a federal agency (VA benefits, service medals, etc.), please call my Plano office at 469-304-0382 or visit my website HERE: http://samjohnson.house.gov/constituentservices/veterans-assistance.htm

BUT WE STILL NEED YOUR HELP with this year's People's Choice Award. From now through Friday, you can vote for your favorite on my website: https://samjohnson.house.gov/forms/form/?ID=3106

As many Americans across the country know firsthand, Obamacare isn’t working. Insurers are fleeing the Obamacare exchanges, premiums are soaring, and millions of folks have chosen to forgo buying Obamacare-mandated insurance because it’s simply too expensive.  This heavy-handed government program is anything but affordable.  Since Day 1, I opposed Obamacare.  Well, now that Republicans control the House, Senate, and White House, we finally have the opportunity to repeal and replace this bad law.  The first step is passing the improved version of the American Health Care Act, as the House did yesterday.  I will be the first to admit this bill is by no means perfect, but it makes great strides forward within the parameters of what we are allowed to do under budget rules so that we are able to pass the bill with a simple majority in the Senate.  As folks know, there are only 52 Senate Republicans.  I look forward to seeing the Senate’s ideas and getting the best and most conservative bill possible on President Trump’s desk soon.  Bottom line: Americans have been waiting for a repeal and replace of Obamacare for seven years.  Now is the time to help provide access for the affordable health care Americans want, need, and deserve.   To learn more about the bill as well as legislation I've introduced to build upon repeal and replace (for veterans and small business), CLICK HERE: http://samjohnson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398728

VOTE NOW! LAST DAY TO SHOW YOUR SUPPORT FOR OUR COLLIN COUNTY STUDENT ARTISTS competing in the Congressional Art Competition! Don't miss the chance to vote for this year's People's Choice Award!  Vote here:   https://samjohnson.house.gov/forms/form/?ID=3106

Happy Mother's Day to all the moms who do so much to their families. Today I am thankful for the example my wife Shirley set for our children and for all she did to bring me and other POWs home. Her faith and unconditional love continue to inspire me. I also wish my daughters a very Happy Mother's Day - I love you both and am proud of you!

Congratulations to this year's winners of the 35th Annual Congressional Art Competition!  The First Place winner of the 2017 Art Competition is Paris Poisso from Allen High School for her artwork, “Accession.”  Poisso’s artwork will soon travel to Washington, D.C. where it will be displayed in the United States Capitol building for one year along with other First Place winners’ artwork from across the nation.  Southwest Airlines will   be giving Poisso two free tickets for roundtrip airfare to Washington, D.C. where she will attend the national 2017 Congressional Art Competition unveiling ceremony in June.   Congratulations again to Paris and all our art winners this year!  To view all the winning artwork, please click HERE: http://samjohnson.house.gov/constituentservices/artcontest.htm

ICYMI, here's an op-ed I wrote discussing the importance of the Disability Insurance program and how we need to make it better.  One way we can do that is by making it easier for folks who want to return to work to do so!  Read on to learn what I'm working on to address this issue!

Today is the 30th Anniversary of Rolling Thunder and its Ride for Freedom. It is an inspiring reminder that we must do all we can to ensure a full accounting for American forces who remain missing in action (MIA). It is ALSO a call to action, and as a 29-year Air Force veteran and former POW, I speak from personal experience when I say that taking action can change lives — it can even save them.  To learn more about my efforts on behalf of our MIA men and women, click on the link below to read my op-ed in a Rolling Thunder Anniversary edition of the Washington Times.   I thank all our troops, veterans, and military families for their service and sacrifice, and I remain dedicated to our Armed Forces promise to "leave no man behind."  God bless you and God bless America. I salute you.   http://m.washingtontimes.com/news/2017/may/24/hanoi-hilton-veteran-we-must-do-all-we-can-for-pow/

On Memorial Day, Americans across the country come together to remember our servicemen and women who paid the ultimate sacrifice in defense of Freedom.   As an Air Force veteran who spent nearly seven years as a POW in Vietnam’s Hoa Lo Prison, I pay special tribute to my fellow comrades who didn’t make it home.  We honor all our fallen service members’ memories and we support their families for their sacrifices.  We also thank our veterans who are with us today. They are all heroes.  God bless you, and God bless America.  I salute you.   While we remember our troops, our veterans, and those who are no longer with us this Memorial Day, I am working year-round to ensure our servicemen and women know their country stands by them.  To read about some of these efforts, please click on the links below:  http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2017/may/24/hanoi-hilton-veteran-we-must-do-all-we-can-for-pow/   https://samjohnson.house.gov/issues/issue/?IssueID=805

ICYMI: my Congressional Youth Advisory Council (CYAC) for 2016-2017 recently celebrated their program graduation.  During the event, they had the privilege to hear from U.S. Marine Sergeant Ben Rangel (who was also a recent recipient of the Congressional Veterans Commendation Award).  To each CYAC student, I again want to thank you for making this year such a success. Y'all worked hard and are well on your way to building a legacy of service on behalf of others.  God bless you and God bless America. I salute you.

73 years ago, our Allied forces stormed the beaches of Normandy to begin liberating Western Europe from Nazi control.    The bravery of these veterans changed the course of World War II, and we continue to honor the sacrifices they made in the name of freedom.  As someone who served in the ROTC during WWII, I will always be thankful to our Greatest Generation.  So today, let us lift up the memories of our WWII veterans who are no longer with us – particularly those who paid the ultimate sacrifice.  Let us also pay special tribute to those who are still with us today.  May we strive to emulate the courage and self-sacrifice of all these veterans in our day-to-day lives.  God bless you and God bless America.  I salute you.

KNOW A VETERAN who you would like to see honored for their military and community service? Nominate them for my final Congressional Veteran Commendation Award! This is an annual event to recognize the veteran heroes in our Third District of Texas. Nominations close July 27th! CLICK HERE for more info and nomination form: https://samjohnson.house.gov/constituentservices/congressional-veteran-commendation-cvc-program.htm

COMING UP SOON, my staff will be hosting a Badges of Honor medals event on Tuesday, June 27th.  This is an event in my Plano office where staff will assist veterans (as well as their spouses and family members) obtain service medals they have earned but either 1) have not yet received, or 2) have had lost or stolen.   The event will be held from 10:00 am - 3:30 pm.    Veterans needing assistance are asked to bring a copy of their DD214 form.  In order to adhere to the Privacy Act of 1974, folks must also be prepared to sign a privacy release form.     Due to limited space, please RSVP by emailing events.tx03@mail.house.gov or by calling (469) 304- 0382.  For more information, click here: https://samjohnson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398755

On Father's Day, I give a prayer of thanks for my loving wife Shirley, who I was blessed to share so many years with and who supported our family through thick and thin. I'm also thankful for our three beautiful children. Being their father is one of the biggest blessings I have received in my life. Most importantly, I'm thankful today for the love of my Heavenly Father - for His example of true love and sacrifice. May we all learn from Him. God bless you and Happy Father's Day. I salute you.

TOMORROW! From 10:00 am - 3:30 pm my staff will be hosting our Badges of Honor medals event to assist veterans (as well as their spouses and children) obtain U.S. service medals they earned but have either 1) never received or, 2) need replaced. DID YOU KNOW? The Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration found in a 2014 report that **the IRS is giving out bonuses to employees with outstanding tax obligations. This is not a hypothetical concern, the report found that the IRS has handed out over $1 million in bonuses, 10,000 hours in extra time off, and 69 step increase to more than 1,100 employees with tax problems.**   TO STOP THIS, I reintroduced the "No Bonuses for Tax Delinquent IRS Employees Act" (H.R. 1599).  It's great to have the support of Americans for Tax Reform! Learn more by following the link below!    Read more: http://www.atr.org/atr-supports-representative-johnsons-no-bonuses-tax-delinquent-irs-employees-act#ixzz4lDRkoaPV  Follow us: @taxreformer on Twitter

Congratulations to my former colleague and friend, Senator Kay Bailey Hutchison, on her nomination to serve as NATO Ambassador.  She worked hard on behalf of Texas during her tenure in the Senate, and I have every faith that she will be a shining success in this new position.
Hello, and Happy Independence Day!  As we gather together to enjoy this holiday, I hope you will join me in remembering how special this day truly is.  We have so much to be thankful for!

On our Independence Day, we remember our country's unique history.  Men and women came to America seeking freedom from persecution.  And our Founding Fathers declared their independence to govern themselves rather than submit to a monarchy. As a result of their courage and wisdom, we are blessed beyond measure to live in a country where we enjoy freedom in its many forms.  Let us be thankful for these freedoms – because there are countries and regimes out there that do NOT recognize or celebrate individual freedom.  And some want to destroy ours. That is why the Fourth of July is also a time when we should pass along WHY our freedom is important.  Each of us plays a role in keeping the legacy of freedom alive.  It is our responsibility to protect and preserve our freedom so that we may pass it on to our children.     On that note, let us thank all our servicemen and women – past and present – who have defended our Great Nation.  It is because of your service and sacrifice that we are able to continue living in the Land of the Free.  Your legacy will not be forgotten!      I pray that God continues to bless our Great Nation.  And I pledge to you that I will continue to uphold the values of freedom and individual liberty, which founded America and our Constitution. God Bless you and your families, and God bless America.  I salute you.

Today marks the one year anniversary when five Dallas police officers were gunned down while protecting peaceful protestors. We honor their memories, keep their families and friends in our prayers, and are grateful for the service and sacrifice of ALL our faithful officers who daily put their lives on the line for others. Each of you are heroes. God bless you and I salute you!

ICYMI, last week Plano officially welcomed the Toyota USA  Headquarters at its Grand Opening event.  There are many reasons this company (and so many others) choose to make Collin County their home, including the fact we are a business and family friendly community! This type of environment is something I am proud to help foster. So it's a pleasure to help welcome Toyota to our neck of the woods.  As a veteran, I also appreciate the fact that Toyota does so much on behalf of all our Great Nation's veterans. In fact, I recently had the privilege of honoring Bob Carter (President of Toyota Motor Sales) and Toyota for the company's continued dedication to supporting our veteran community. I thank everyone who came out to support and welcome this new addition to Collin County!

TEN DAYS LEFT to nominate a veteran you know for the FINAL Congressional Veteran Commendation (CVC) award! This annual award ceremony recognizes the military service of our local veterans as well as their community service when they return to civilian life. Nominations must be in by July 27th. Last night, the Appropriations Committee passed the Transportation, Housing and Urban Development funding bill, which includes my legislation to reinstate approval for states to use Clearview font on road signs. This is great news! For over a decade, states have been allowed to use Clearview font – a font that can be seen at further distances, allowing drivers more time to react.  However, last year the Federal Highway Administration in Washington revoked the use of this innovative font. With this bill, for the next year states would once again have the choice to use Clearview font to improve road safety. I look forward to also passing my broader SIGN Act to permanently provide states the choice of using the driver-friendly, easy-to-read Clearview font.

As a combat veteran of two wars, I take our nation’s foreign policy very seriously. So I was proud to vote today for legislation (H.R. 3364) that will impose greater sanctions on Russia, Iran, and North Korea. The world today is a dangerous place, and these countries have engaged in increasingly aggressive actions. Take for example Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, North Korea’s ballistic missile launches, and Iran’s threatening actions in the Persian Gulf. I remain committed to standing up to America’s adversaries and was proud to vote in support of H.R. 3364 today.

I am deeply troubled by this news. As Social Security Chairman I’ve made it a top priority to protect Social Security numbers. Sixteen years ago, radical Islamic terrorists ruthlessly attacked our country by hijacking four plans that crashed into the World Trade Center, Pentagon, and a field in Pennsylvania. Nearly 3,000 people were murdered in these attacks.  But rather than break our spirit as these terrorists intended, our nation united together and folks stepped up to serve their neighbors – and their country.  Eleven years later, in 2012, our American embassy in Benghazi was attacked – again by Islamic terrorists.  Four Americans were killed, including Ambassador J. Christopher Stevens.   Today, the threat of terrorism remains very real, which is why we must continue to be vigilant and do everything within our power to prevent future attacks on Americans.  This is one of the best ways we can honor the memories of those we have lost.  It is also one of the best ways we can show our thanks to our first responders and service members.  I invite folks to join me in a prayer of support and remembrance for all the families and friends who were impacted on these tragic days.  We will never forget.

In honor of POW/MIA day, I want to let folks – particularly our veterans and military families – know what I’m doing to help return all missing and unaccounted-for United States personnel.  Earlier this year, I introduced a resolution, H.Res. 129, which calls on the U.S. government to intensify efforts to account for the 83,000 American service members who are still unaccounted for around the world.  This resolution also calls on foreign governments to fully assist in search and recovery efforts.  As the year moves forward, know that I am looking to have the House pass this legislation. It is the least we can do for our MIAs and their families – they faithfully served our country and each day that passes without answers is more difficult.    To all our veterans and their families, know that I will continue to be a champion for you in Washington.  God bless you and I salute you.

Today is the 70th Anniversary of our United States Air Force! As a combat veteran of this branch, I recently introduced H.Res. 510, which commemorates the 70th anniversary of the establishment of the Air Force.  This resolution also honors all of our Airmen who have served and defended this Great Nation. I want to give my heartfelt thanks to all our Air Force service members – past and present. Thank you for your dedication to defending freedom and protecting your fellow Americans.   God bless you and God bless America.  I salute you!

ICYMI, yesterday was Gold Star Mother's Day. God bless you and I salute you.

America’s current tax code is complicated and broken, and right now we have an opportunity to fundamentally reform it for the 21st Century.   Not only does Washington have a much-needed chance to make the code simpler – which I strongly believe is necessary, but it’s an opportunity to enable businesses so they are better able to compete in the global economy.  Even more important, tax reform should reward hardworking American families.   This blueprint is a first step. We must get tax reform right, and I look forward to working with my fellow Ways and Means colleagues on behalf of America’s taxpayers.  To learn more about the Blueprint, CLICK HERE: https://fairandsimple.gop/?utm_source=JOLT&utm_campaign=4100ba7b14-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2017_04_24&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_9655b8353e-4100ba7b14-147171721  To read the Blueprint, CLICK HERE: https://gallery.mailchimp.com/301a28247b80ab82279e92afb/files/2715c1a9-87f3-459c-95d5-4d7d7cc6e391/Tax_Framework_FINAL.01.pdf?utm_source=JOLT&utm_campaign=4100ba7b14-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2017_04_24&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_9655b8353e-4100ba7b14-147171721

ICYMI, on September 7th, 2017, Equifax, one of the three primary credit reporting agencies in the U.S., revealed that it had a data breach.  This data breach resulted in the theft of sensitive information of at least 143 million Americans.  The fact that several government agencies – including the Social Security Administration (SSA) – contract with Equifax for identity verification services compounds the seriousness of this breach.  Americans expect government agencies to safeguard their personal information.  **IN RESPONSE, earlier this week I held a bipartisan Member roundtable with senior SSA officials.  The roundtable focused on the agency’s cybersecurity response to the Equifax breach, anticipated risks as a result of the breach, and what the SSA is doing to mitigate those risks for both the agency and the public.  While I am encouraged by the SSA’s actions to protect the public and its own systems, please know that I will continue to keep a close eye on this issue as more information becomes available.

Jeb Hensarling is a dear friend with whom I’ve had the pleasure of working with over the years.  He’s both a statesman and a rock solid conservative who puts his constituents and country first.   I remember when we worked together to get the Wright Amendment repealed several years ago.  People said it couldn’t be done, but we fought hard and made it happen.  And since 2014, Love Field is now able to fly non-stop flights.  This is just one meaningful impact Jeb has had on our North Texas community - and there are so many more.  I wish Jeb the best of luck and know that his service to our country will continue outside the Halls of Congress.  God bless you and I salute you, friend!

America’s complicated and broken tax code is hurting our economy and, in turn, American families.  That’s why I’ve long said we need a simpler tax code that rewards hard work.  I’m encouraged to see that the bill introduced today would provide tax relief for working families and the middle class as well as much-needed pro-growth business reforms. I’m also encouraged to see some of my commonsense bills included in the legislation.  I look forward to taking the next step toward tax reform, and I will continue to do everything I can to make this bill the best it can be. Reforming America’s complicated and broken tax code is too important to not get right.  ** To read the bill in its entirety, CLICK HERE:https://waysandmeansforms.house.gov/uploadedfiles/bill_text.pdf  ** For a section by section summary of the bill, CLICK HERE:  https://samjohnson.house.gov/uploadedfiles/tax_reform_bill_section_by_section.pdf  ** To read about the legislation I introduced that is included in the bill, CLICK HERE: https://samjohnson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398857

As a 29-year Air Force veteran, I want to wish all our veterans a Happy Veterans Day!  While our country takes time today to recognize and pay tribute to your service and sacrifice, I hope you know that our gratitude extends BEYOND this one day.  The Freedom we continue to enjoy is made possible because of your efforts.    I also want to recognize and remember all our POWs, MIAs, and their families.  This week, the U.S. Congress had a ceremony to unveil a commemorative chair in honor of all our POWs and MIAs.  It was a blessing to be part of this event heading into Veterans Day, and I hope that whenever anyone visits the Capitol and views this chair they are reminded of the men and women who are willing to give up their OWN freedom – and even their lives – in defense of OUR freedom.  We are tremendously blessed by their sacrifice.  We should remember them – and their families – and NEVER stop showing our gratitude.    God bless ALL our veterans and military families, and God bless America.  I salute you.

Today I introduced the Strengthening Protections for Social Security Beneficiaries Act of 2017 (H.R. 4547), bipartisan legislation to improve and strengthen the Social Security Administration’s (SSA) representative payee program. The Social Security Administration has a big responsibility to make sure Americans who need help managing their benefits get it. But the program doesn’t always work the way it should. Too often, we hear stories about representative payees who take advantage of those they are supposed to help. Ranking Member Larson and I worked together on this legislation in order to strengthen the representative payee program so that it better protects beneficiaries and reduces burdensome government paperwork that rarely provides any real value for families. Too many Americans are counting on the Social Security Administration to get this right.   To learn more, click here: https://waysandmeans.house.gov/johnson-larson-introduce-bipartisan-legislation-strengthen-social-securitys-representative-payee-program/

Today marks 76 years since the attack on Pearl Harbor. As Americans, we continue to honor the memories of those who were lost.  This is also a time when we reflect on how our nation came together in the name of freedom – both those who served in uniform and those who served at home in their daily lives in support of our Armed Forces.   I pray America continually strives to emulate the determination and strong moral character of the Greatest Generation.  To all our veterans who served in WWII and their families, I thank you for your service, your sacrifice, and your example.  God bless you and God bless America.  I salute you.

Today I took to the House Floor to once again urge President Trump to nominate a Social Security Commissioner - a position that has been vacant for nearly 5 years.  To learn more about my efforts on this issue and why it's important, CLICK HERE: https://samjohnson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398862

With only 12 days until Christmas, I will be doing a Countdown to Christmas as 2017 wraps up.  Beginning the countdown for #12…as many of you know, in January I announced that the 115th Congress would be my last term in the U.S. House of Representatives.  That means 12 months to focus on key priorities for 3rd District constituents – priorities like supporting our veterans, providing water for North Texas through a much-needed reservoir, and supporting fiscally responsible bills to save taxpayers’ dollars.  I look forward to working on your behalf and having a productive 2018!

11 days ‘till Christmas! Did you know my District Office in Plano provides a number of constituent services and outreach programs throughout the year?  This year included, 1) the “Badges of Honor” service medals event for veterans; 2) the U.S. Service Academy Info Session; 3) the Congressional Art Competition for high school students; 4) Medicare Info Sessions; 5) the Congressional App Competition for local students; 6) the Congressional Youth Advisory Council; 7) the “Valentines for Veterans” program; 8) the “Honor our Stars and Stripes” flag retirement program; 9) the Congressional Veterans Commendation Ceremony; 10) a water info event with the North Texas Municipal Water District; and 11) a Veteran’s History Project training workshop.   For updates on events and programs for 2018, check my Facebook and website or give my Plano office a call at 469-304-0382.

My Christmas Countdown continues!  10 days until Christmas: Did you know that this year my staff held 10 Mobile Office Hour days where they traveled to 37 locations to provide conveniently located constituent services for folks? While my staff provides year-round assistance for 3rd District constituents who need help with a federal agency, we understand that not everyone can make it into the Plano office for in-person help.  That’s why we work to come to you!  If you need assistance with a federal agency, please click on the link below for more information.  You can also call my Plano office at 469-304-0382.      https://samjohnson.house.gov/constituentservices/casework/

9 days until Christmas! Here are 9 ways the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act tax reform will help families and small businesses:   1. It cuts income tax rates on middle income Americans; 2. It doubles the standard deduction for both individuals and families;  3. It significantly increases the child tax credit;  4. It provides major tax relief for main street small businesses; 5. It simplifies the tax system – saving you time and money; 6. It encourages companies to invest and grow jobs in the U.S.;  7. It helps folks save for retirement with my Savings Enhancement by Alleviating Leakage in 401(k) Savings Act (H.R. 2030);  8. It increases our nation’s energy security by allowing energy development in a portion of the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge (ANWR); and  9. It repeals Obamacare’s individual mandate tax. Of those households paying the tax, 80 percent make under $50,000.

7 days until Christmas! This year my staff and I hosted the seventh and FINAL Congressional Veterans Commendation (CVC) ceremony.  Third District constituents nominated 20 local veterans who were recognized for their military and community service.  This is always a special event, and I thank everyone who came out to support our hometown heroes.  I also thank ALL our veterans for their service and sacrifice in defense of FREEDOM.   To learn more about my efforts on behalf of veterans (including legislation I introduced to recover the remains of our MIAs, bills like my Servicemember Retirement Improvement Act, and efforts to fund our military), CLICK HERE: https://samjohnson.house.gov/issues/issue/?IssueID=805

The Christmas Countdown continues with 6 days until the holiday.  On that note, here are six bills I introduced this year that will save taxpayers’ dollars: 1) the Wasteful EPA Programs Elimination Act, the No Bonuses for Tax Delinquent IRS Employees Act; 3) the Social Security Disability Insurance and Unemployment Benefits Double Dip Elimination Act; 4) the Refundable Child Tax Credit Eligibility Verification Reform Act, 5) the Social Security Travel Reimbursement Reform Act; and 6) the EITC Eligibility Verification Act.  To learn more about these bills, CLICK HERE: https://samjohnson.house.gov/legislation/

5 days ‘till Christmas! ICYMI, this year I chaired five Social Security Subcommittee hearings on a variety of issues. Most recently we covered the representative payee program and the issues it faces.  In response, Ranking Member John Larson and I introduced the Strengthening Protections for Social Security Beneficiaries Act of 2017 (H.R. 4547) on December 5th. To learn more about this bill, CLICK HERE:  https://waysandmeans.house.gov/johnson-larson-introduce-bipartisan-legislation-strengthen-social-securitys-representative-payee-program/

Just 4 days until Christmas. Did you know that this year I introduced four health-related bills? Two bills are focused on providing more affordable health care options for small businesses and small communities (the Small Business Health Fairness Act and the Patient Access to Higher Quality Health Care Act).  The other two bills work to provide better health care options for our veterans (the HEARTS Act and the VETERANS Act). ICYMI, check out my op-ed in the Wall Street Journal on the Small Business Health Fairness Act, which passed the House on March 22nd.   https://samjohnson.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398830

In honor of 3 Days until Christmas, I’m highlighting this year’s Congressional Youth Advisory Council (CYAC), which held its third meeting of the school year this month. At the meeting, the CYAC class met with Collin County Commissioner-Precinct 1 Susan Fletcher, Plano Mayor Pro Tempore Rick Grady, State Representative Jodie Laubenberg, Judge John Payton, and Assistant Plano Police Chief Brad Fortune.  Each student had the opportunity to sit with each leader and engage in meaningful dialogue about leadership in the community.  To learn more about CYAC and all their meetings so far, CLICK HERE: https://samjohnson.house.gov/constituentservices/congressionalyouthadvisorycouncil.htm

With 2 days left until Christmas, today I’m highlighting a bill I had signed into law earlier this year that protects the 2nd Amendment rights of Social Security beneficiaries.   As a Constitutional conservative, I am a proud defender of all law-abiding Americans’ 2nd Amendment rights.  Former President Obama, on the other hand, made gun control a priority of his.  He repeatedly tried to impose his radical gun control agenda on law-abiding Americans.  Thankfully, the American people and House Republicans were able to STOP him.   But because he failed in Congress, the former president sought to deny millions of folks their right to bear arms by going through Social Security.   In the final hours of his presidency, Obama finalized a Social Security Administration rule.  His rule would mean certain Social Security beneficiaries who also happen to have someone they know and trust handle their Social Security checks for them would be prevented from buying a gun.  This is WRONG!  Old age or a disability does NOT make someone a threat to society.  All law-abiding citizens should have the right to own a firearm. Period. That’s why on January 30th I introduced a resolution that would stop former President Obama’s gun grab.  I am pleased that on February 2nd, 2017, the House passed my resolution by a bipartisan vote of 235-180.

On Christmas Eve, with just 1 day left, the Christmas Countdown is coming to a close!  This year we welcomed one new Justice, Neil Gorsuch, to the United States Supreme Court.  Justice Gorsuch is a man who upholds the Constitution as our Founding Fathers intended, and I believe him to be a fitting and honorable successor to Justice Scalia.  I’m also encouraged by the court’s decision to rule in favor of Trinity Lutheran Church in the case, Trinity Lutheran Church vs. Comer.  This is a victory that protects freedom of religion.  As someone who went without this freedom for nearly seven years as a POW, it’s a right we can sometimes take for granted. I pray our Court will continue to uphold the Constitution as it makes other important decisions in the New Year.

On Christmas day, I want to wish you and your family a very blessed holiday!   As we remember the reason for the season, let us also be mindful of how fortunate we are to live in America, where our freedom is protected under the Constitution.  This same freedom is defended by all our servicemen and women. However, holidays can be hard for our service members who are away from home. So to all our military families – past and present – please know that your service and sacrifice are appreciated…and that your fellow Americans are supporting you today.  On that note, I pray that you and your family have a joyful Christmas and a Happy New Year!  God bless you and God bless America.  I salute you.
